---
  description: Add a small amount of random variation to the location of each point and then convert them with ggplotly.
  function: geom_jitter
  permalink: /ggplot2/layers/geoms/geom_jitter/
  layout: base
  language: ggplot2
  name: geom_jitter
  reference: https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/
---

# Default point plot

<pre class="mcode">
p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(cyl, hwy))
p <-  p + geom_point()

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Jitter plot

<pre class="mcode">
p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(cyl, hwy))
p <-  p + geom_jitter()

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Adding colour

<pre class="mcode">
p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(cyl, hwy))
p <-  p + geom_jitter(aes(colour = class))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Modifying width and height to improve readability

You can use smaller width/height to emphasise categories. 

Default plot:


<pre class="mcode">
p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(cyl, hwy))
p <-    
 ggplot(mpg, aes(cyl, hwy)) +
  geom_jitter()
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(cyl, hwy))
p <-    
 ggplot(mpg, aes(cty, hwy)) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.5, height = 0.5)
